column5: Hey all, just realized I have been smoke free now for 3 years and a day.  Should have done this ages ago, but hey, it is what it is.  Still crave like crazy sometimes but it's just a craving and will pass, don't have to act on it.  To all you other quitters and potential quittersâ€¦..good luck !
18 years and counting and still have cravings from time to time. Keep at it!
Well done Simon !!  23 years for me.
15 months and getting easier all the time! Took a 1 day seminar and never looked back!
3 1/2 years for me And coming up to 3 years off the booze in July! Thankful for every day of it too
20+ years ago for me. Good for you.  Now, if I could only do something about the wine.
25 years for me. Never was a regular smoker, more of a casual one, but still glad I ditched them.  Now, if I could only do something about the wine.  Send it to me for disposal. I, uh, recycle it.
2 years, 5 months for me. One of the toughest things i ever did. Quit cold turkey. Good job to you all
Quit in 2011, and I know that if I had one I'd be hooked again.
quit many years ago. best decision I ever made!!
It'll be 3 years this September for me!  Love it...hate smoking, never again.  Quitting is awesome.  Feel great!
7 months for me. Cravings come and go. Tried to quit a zillion times. Hopefully this is it!!
25 years, still want one every now and then  5, 6 beers and they really look good

Ya know---I too quit many, many moons ago  When do I still miss them....I've spent lots of time in the bush hunting  If your a hunter you'll understand the timeframes-----after I pulled the hammer----Ya gotta wait---that's when a cigar was really good  Sittin under a tree---all is quiet--alone in the forest------yeah I do miss it
Just the smell of them makes me ill now so I will never pick it up ever again. Now me rum is a whole nuther thing.
